alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 24 at 1:17AM CDT until September 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN BARRY, SOUTHERN CHRISTIAN, STONE AND NORTHERN TANEY COUNTIES... At 117 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Branson, Monett, Forsyth, Merriam Woods, Crane, Reeds Spring, Rockaway Beach, Branson West, Galena, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Mccord Bend, Hurley, Spokane, Chestnutridge, Ponce de Leon, Walnut Shade, Cape Fair, Elsey, Garrison, Wheelerville, Jenkins, Bradleyville, Madry, Brownbranch, Pleasant Ridge, Lake Taneycomo, Table Rock Lake and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road, Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Stout Creek at Hulls Ford Road, Caney Creek at Caney Creek RD, Dry Crane Creek at Jasmine Road and Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
